meanings.definition: A type of branching in plants where lateral branches arise in pairs from a main stem.
meanings.sent1: The plant's sympodia displayed beautiful pairs of branches growing from the main stem.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the sympodia of the tree, noting how the branches grew in twos from the central trunk.
meanings.sent3: The symmetrical sympodia of the bush made it look like a natural work of art.
meanings.sent4: The garden resembled a painting with its sympodia branches forming a perfect pattern.
meanings.sent5: The textbook had a detailed illustration showing the structure of sympodia in plants.

meanings.definition: A type of architectural ornamentation consisting of a group of columns or pilasters.

meanings.sent2: The museum guide explained the significance of the sympodia decorating the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The quirky design of the house included whimsical sympodia columns at the front.
meanings.sent4: The grand hall's sympodia columns seemed to hold up the weight of history.
